author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! âœ…

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. 

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
@ChrisRackauckas Perhaps a license has to be added to all the packages in the repo?
oh that's annoying. Yeah I can add it to each.

I don't know if there is a way to have these packages look one level further up when in a multi-package repo. Perhaps this is in @KristofferC's wheelhouse?

In any case, it may be quicker to add the licenses.

I'll just add the licenses but report that this could probably be improved. I generally need to write an issue about how this should all be done using Julia submodules but there are missing features that makes this use packages instead. I haven't gotten around to writing all of this though. But for simplicity, I'll just copy paste the same license file 20 times and call it a day for now.
Since only the subfolder is actually shipped to users there has to be a license there.

body:
- Registering package: OrdinaryDiffEqCore
- Repository: https://github.com/SciML/OrdinaryDiffEq.jl
- Created by: @ChrisRackauckas
- Version: v1.0.0
- Commit: 65946a86b8acd900ec38dd5e80f3c51d901f7771
- Reviewed by: @ChrisRackauckas
- Reference: https://github.com/SciML/OrdinaryDiffEq.jl/issues/845#issuecomment-2284972157
- Description: High performance ordinary differential equation (ODE) and differential-algebraic equation (DAE) solvers, including neural ordinary differential equations (neural ODEs) and scientific machine learning (SciML)

title: New package: OrdinaryDiffEqCore v1.0.0
